org.jsonschema2pojo.rules.FormatRule

Rule<com.sun.codemodel.JType,com.sun.codemodel.JType>
public class FormatRule extends Object implements Rule<com.sun.codemodel.JType,com.sun.codemodel.JType>
Applies the "format" schema rule.

  • Method Details

    • apply

      public com.sun.codemodel.JType apply(String nodeName, com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode node, com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode parent, com.sun.codemodel.JType baseType, Schema schema)
      Applies this schema rule to take the required code generation steps.

      This rule maps format values to Java types. By default:

      • "format":"date-time" => Date or DateTime (if config useJodaDates is set)
      • "format":"date" => String or LocalDate (if config useJodaLocalDates is set)
      • "format":"time" => String or LocalTime (if config useJodaLocalTimes is set)
      • "format":"utc-millisec" => long
      • "format":"regex" => Pattern
      • "format":"color" => String
      • "format":"style" => String
      • "format":"phone" => String
      • "format":"uri" => URI
      • "format":"email" => String
      • "format":"ip-address" => String
      • "format":"ipv6" => String
      • "format":"host-name" => String
      • "format":"uuid" => UUID
      • other (unrecognised format) => baseType
      Specified by:
      apply in interface Rule<com.sun.codemodel.JType,com.sun.codemodel.JType>
      Parameters:
      nodeName - the name of the node to which this format is applied
      node - the format node
      parent - the parent node
      baseType - the type which which is being formatted e.g. for { "type" : "string", "format" : "uri" } the baseType would be java.lang.String
      schema - the schema to which this schema rule (and the given node) belongs.
      Returns:
      the Java type that is appropriate for the format value
